#summary The SVG <rect> element represents a rectangle.
You are here: [Welcome Home] > [SVGElements SVG Elements] > *rect element*

= Introduction =

The rect element is used to create a rectangle.

= Details =
== Usage ==

{{{
<rect x="50" y="50" width="200" height="100" fill="green" />
}}}

== Attributes ==

Common attributes:

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#RectElementXAttribute x] - the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.  Defaults to 0.
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#RectElementYAttribute y] - the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.  Defaults to 0.
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#RectElementWidthAttribute width] - the width of the rectangle.  Must be non-negative.  If 0, the rectangle will not render.  Defaults to 0.
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/shapes.html#RectElementHeightAttribute height] - the height of the rectangle.  Must be non-negative.  If 0, the rectangle will not render.  Defaults to 0.
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/painting.html#FillProperty fill] - describes how the interior of the rectangle should be painted, see [SVGFillProperties].  The default value is "black".
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/painting.html#StrokeProperty stroke] - describes how the outline of the rectangle should be painted, see [SVGStrokeProperties]. The default value is "none".
